item.title: A day in NYC
item.description: If I were to design a day in NYC, it would go like this. Get a latte and pastry at Butler. Spend an hour sitting there. Get a breakfast sandwich at Bread and Spread Walk around Brooklyn Bridge Park. Play pickleball, ping pong, frisbee, or catch at Pier 2. The lockers have free equipment you can borrow. Take the train to Prospect Park. Citibike around the park. Get dinner at One More Charm.

item.title: 10 songs for 2023
item.description: For four years now, I’ve made a playlist of my top songs every month. The idea was to create a musical diary of sorts. When I listen to December 2019, some of the thoughts I was having at the time come rushing back. As my December 2023 playlist comes to an end, I want to start a new tradition of reflecting on the 10 songs that defined my year, roughly in chronological order.

item.title: How I learned to ride a bike
item.description: First attempt # When I was 8, my parents tried to teach me to ride a bike. I started with training wheels. One day, I fell off my bike (with training wheels), and the wound took a month to heal. I never rode that bike again. Second attempt # My freshman year of college, my friends and I were walking around campus at midnight. Specifically, we were in between the Physical Sciences Building and Klarman Hall.
